html:
• anchor

    Quinn Chapel AME Church in Frederick, MD. Photo: Kelly Paras

    The National Trust for Historic Preservation’s dedicated African American Cultural Heritage Action Fund has announced a new round of grants totaling $8.5 million that will be put towards the restoration of 30 historically significant Black churches in 19 states. 

    In announcing what is now the third round of funding through the Preserving Black Churches (PBC) program, executive director Brent Leggs called them "enduring symbols of faith, strength, and community leadership."

    He added: "By preserving them, we ensure that their powerful presence continues to live on in their communities and inspire future generations."

    The bastions of Black communities nationwide and a testament to their endurance, historical churches, have become a focal point of the $60 million in funding secured by the Action Fund after its establishment in 2017. The 2025 grants, ranging from $50,000 to $500,000, will be put towards addressing "urgent preservation challenges" which include demolition threats, deferred maintenance, structural issues, HVAC, and other mechanical upgrades.

    The full list of 30 churches includes:

    • The AME Zion Church Inc. - Charlotte, NC
    • Soapstone Baptist Church - Marietta, SC
    • West Hunter Street Baptist Church - Atlanta, GA
    • Cleveland Restoration Society - Cleveland, OH
    • Clark E. Scales First AME Church of Athens - Athens, GA
    • Campbell African Methodist Episcopal Church of Media - Media, PA
    • Ninth Street Missionary Baptist Church - Lawrence, KS
    • Dabney Hill Missionary Baptist Church - Snook, TX
    • St. John African Methodist Episcopal Church - Frankfort, KY
    • New Tabernacle Fourth Baptist Church - Charleston, SC
    • AME Zion Church of Kingston - Kingston, NY
    • Historic Bethel Baptist Church - Birmingham, AL
    • St. Paul United Methodist Church - Birmingham, AL
    • First Congregational Church of Marion - Marion, AL
    • St. Mark's Presbyterian Church - Cleveland, OH
    • GLIDE Memorial Church (GLIDE Foundation) - San Francisco, CA
    • Dickerson Chapel AME Church - Hillsborough, NC
    • Zoar Methodist Episcopal Church (Friends of Zoar Inc.) - Odessa, DE
    • Bethel African Methodist Episcopal Church - Lancaster, PA
    • St. James AME Church in Columbus, OH
    • Taveau Church (Preservation South Carolina) - Moncks Corner, SC
    • St. James AME Church - Columbus, GA
    • Antioch Baptist Church - Shreveport, LA
    • Historic Pickett Chapel (Wilson County Black History Committee) - Lebanon, TN
    • Quinn Chapel AME Church - Frederick, MD
    • Boynton Chapel Methodist Church - Houston, TX
    • New Bethel Baptist Church - Detroit, MI
    • Mount Carmel Missionary Baptist Church - Milwaukee, WI
    • Anna Bell Chapel AME Church (New Haven Preservation Society)
      - New Haven, MO
    • New Salem Baptist Church (Preservation Alliance of West Virginia, Inc.) - Elkins, WV
    • St. Alphonsus Liguori "Rock" Catholic Church - St. Louis, MO

    The third round of PBC grants is more than double the Action Fund's previous 2024 iteration. Archinect recently spoke to Brent Leggs for a 2025 prospectus of AEC professionals in which he remarked: "I think 2025 will be a year where we see more expansive, creative, and diverse approaches to preservation as these projects continue to succeed and inspire people to engage with history in new ways."
